the same time with food poisoning. The persons who have consumed or eaten the contaminated food item from the same source, usually at a wedding feast or public event/festival celebrations have:
✱  Often, severe vomiting.
✱  Diarrhoea.
✱  Abdominal pain.
Contamination of food, leading to food poisoning can occur in a family kitchen affecting only the family members.  It can also affect a large number of people simultaneously, where the same food is 
cooked in an open or spread out area,that is not 
hygienic, and served to all of them at the same time.  
What to do in suspected food 
poisoning?
Management of the individual patient is essentially 
the same as described for a patient with diarrhoea. However, it is important to remember that patients with food-poisoning may have profuse (severe) 
vomiting and are in danger of getting dehydrated.
